Article.Abstract: The protective capacity of monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) generated to the dengue-2 virus envelope (E) and premembrane (prM) proteins was tested in vivo. Two anti-E MAbs, 2C5.1 and 4G2 and two anti-prM MAbs, 2A4.1 and 2H2 provided cross-protection against all four dengue virus serotypes. Overlapping sets of synthetic peptides spanning amino-acid sequence 301-401 (domain III) of the E protein and the entire prM protein were then used to locate their epitopes. The anti-E MAbs strongly reacted with the peptide sequence 349-GRLITVNPIVT-359 (E349-359) from domain III and the immunodominant epitope, 274-SGNLLFTGHL-283 (E274-283) from the hinge region between domains I and II. The anti-prM MAbs strongly reacted with the sequence, 40-PGFTVMAAIL-49 (M40-49) from the first membrane-spanning domain of the M protein. These anti-prM MAbs also reacted with peptides E274-283 and E349-359, while the anti-E MAbs reacted with a peptide sequence, 1-FHLTTRNGEP-10 from the prM protein and these cross-reactions with both proteins were confirmed using immunoblot assays. MAbs 2C5.1, 4G2 and 2H2 more strongly reacted with an MEH1 peptide GLFTPNLITI, which was designed as an antigenic hybrid between these E and prM peptide sequences, than with any of these natural peptide sequences. These peptide sequence will now be tested for their ability to generate cross-protective antibodies against each dengue virus serotype when delivered with appropriate T-helper epitopes.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification of an epitope on the dengue virus membrane (M) protein defined by cross-protective monoclonal antibodies: design of an improved epitope sequence based on common determinants present in both envelope (E and M) proteins.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Infectious and Tropical Diseases, London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, London, U.K.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning amino acids 301-401 of the E protein. In this assay, the monoclonal antibodies exhibited a stronger reactivity with the corresponding peptide sequence from the attenuated dengue 2 virus strain which contains an amino acid substitution at the fourth residue.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning amino acids 301-401 of the E protein. In this assay, the monoclonal antibodies exhibited reactivity with a peptide which was derived from the prM protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning amino acids 301-401 of the E protein. The monoclonal antibodies showed greater specificities for the peptide spanning residues 349-357 in the reverse orientation.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Similar reactivities were shown against dengue virus types 1, 2, 3, and 4.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning amino acids 301-401 of the E protein. In this assay, the monoclonal antibodies exhibited a stronger reactivity with the corresponding peptide sequence from the attenuated dengue 2 virus strain which contains an amino acid substitution at the fourth residue.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning amino acids 301-401 of the E protein. In this assay, the monoclonal antibodies exhibited reactivity with a peptide located within the postulated hinge region between domains I and II of the E protein. Monoclonal antibody 4G2 showed a slightly stronger reaction with the peptide sequence SGNILFTGH in which L4 was substituted by the more hydrophobic residue, isoleucine. Both monoclonal antibodies showed equal reactivity to the peptide presented in the reverse orientation.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning amino acids 301-401 of the E protein. In this assay, the monoclonal antibodies exhibited reactivity with a peptide which was designed an an antigenic hybrid between two peptides from the E and prM proteins recognized by these monoclonal antibodies.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Similar reactivities were shown against proteins from dengue virus types 1, 2, 3, and 4.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is said to be located at positions 40-49 within the first membrane-spanning domain of the M protein of Dengue virus 2. Sequence of this protein found in current databases do not harbor this sequence but PGFTIMAAIL. An internal database source is provided here to account for the discrepancy between the reported sequence and that found in current genebank/swiss-prot databases.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Three boosters were administered, with the final booster delivered intravenously.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were harvested and fused with mouse plasmacytoma cell line SP20 Ag14.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specificity of these monoclonal antibodies was identified by scan of overlapping peptides spanning the entire prM sequence. In this assay, the monoclonal antibodies exhibited reactivity with a peptide located within the postulated hinge region between domains I and II of the E protein. Both monoclonal antibodies showed equal reactivity to the peptide presented in the reverse orientation.
